name: AR-K: The Great Escape
description: AR-K: The Great Escape is the third episode in the classic point and click saga of AR-K. Help Alicia Van Volish to escape from District 8 and discover the source of the mysterious Golden Sphere through a great story, written by the 3 times Eisner award-winning writer Greg Rucka.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1 Processor: Intel/AMD Dual Core or similar Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 1GB Storage: 4 GB available space

reviews.review_text: This game is part 3 of the series, and it has better overall polish than parts 1 and 2. In the first two installments, they established the setting and characters, though the game mechanics were not polished. The puzzles were troublesome more on account of a clumsy user interface, though this was in addition to the puzzles being somewhat obscure (i.e., just keep rubbing items together until something works).  Part 3 is a more satisfying, polished experience, in terms of plot structure, character motivations, puzzle logic, artwork, and user interface. If you want to skip parts 1 and 2, then all you need to understand for part 3 is the following:   -- SPOILERS --    The lead character (Alicia) was framed for having stolen a golden sphere, about the size of a softball. The sphere is a piece of high technology that can hold an electric charge. The origins of the sphere are unknown, though more is revealed in part 3.  Alicia has a love interest (Blaine) that works for a corporation that has an interest in the golden sphere.  Blaine has an ex-love interest whom also works for the corporation.  Alicia has a friend, Franky, who is essentially an alien minotaur. Though Franky was a minor supporting character in parts 1 and 2, he takes on a more important role in part 3.

The first part of this adventure needs some love because it has some minor flaws but nothing to serious. The good part is, it only gets better and better! I had a lot of fun playing this game and I am surely looking out for the fourth part. I can recommend this game to everyone who loves adventures, especially the 3rd part as about as good as an adventure can get :)  Highly recommended (and bare with the first part, its fun as well!)
It is way better then the first 2 episodes in any aspect. Menu's are better dialogs are better. Also the main character is more likeable - good job !

I loved the Great Escape. The murder mystery puzzle was tricky, but for the most part I was able to figure things out pretty well. I liked all of the episodes, but I really appreciated that Alicia, the main character, didn't really swear in this one. She was still sassy and spunky though, which is the part of her personality that I like. This was a fun and funny puzzle solving adventure game that I really enjoyed, along the same lines as Monkey Island and in the tradition of King's Quest (with fewer puns and dying).
